intro: Oreodaphne odorata, commonly known as the fragrant daphne, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Its aromatic leaves and flowers make it a valuable species in traditional medicine and horticulture. Oreodaphne odorata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests.
